title: Panic in the US Music Industry as TikTok Faces Ban and Competitors Surge
summary: The US Supreme Court upheld a law that could ban TikTok by January 19 unless its parent company, ByteDance, divests ownership, citing national security concerns. TikTok is under pressure to respond while alternative platforms like Xiaohongshu gain millions of new users amid fears of a possible shutdown. The music industry faces uncertainty due to TikTok's crucial role in music promotion, and users are sharing life hacks learned from the app as they explore new social media platforms while awaiting the final decision on TikTok's fate.

sources.title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban law
Trump Comments on TikTok Ban
How TikTok backed itself into a corner
TikTok threatens to go offline if Biden doesn't intervene
Chinese rival app Xiaohongshu is overwhelmed by ‘TikTok refugees’ in US
Never have stale crisps again… nine invaluable things I’ve learned from TikTok
‘A lot of chaos, quickly’: panic grips US music industry as ‘kingmaker’ TikTok faces ban

title: Whitney Wolfe Herd Returns as Bumble CEO Amid Dating App Challenges
summary: Whitney Wolfe Herd will return as Bumble's CEO in March 2025 after stepping down in 2023, succeeding Lidiane Jones, who resigned for personal reasons. The company faces sluggish growth, with Q3 2024 revenue dropping to $274 million despite an increase in paying users to 4.3 million. Although Bumble anticipates Q4 revenue to exceed projections, challenges persist in the dating app market, including declining user engagement and rising concerns about scams.

sources.title: Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd to reclaim CEO position in March
Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd returns as CEO amid a dating app decline

title: PowerSchool Data Breach: Impact and Community Response
summary: A significant cyberattack on PowerSchool, discovered on December 28, has exposed sensitive information, including Social Security numbers and medical data of over 60 million students across 18,000 schools. The breach was initiated when credentials were stolen from a PowerSchool engineer's computer via LummaC2 malware in January 2024. PowerSchool reported that the compromised account lacked multi-factor authentication, a measure now adopted. In response to the breach, affected individuals, led by Romy Backus, collaborated to investigate and share findings through shared documents and group chats.

sources.title: Malware stole internal PowerSchool passwords from engineer’s hacked computer
How victims of PowerSchool’s data breach helped each other investigate ‘massive’ hack

title: SpaceX’s fiery Starship explosion put on a fantastic show but delayed and diverted flights
summary:
- The SpaceX Starship explosion created a colorful debris display, resembling a meteor shower.
- The incident delayed flights, with the FAA diverting planes around the debris field.
- The explosion occurred 8.5 minutes after launch, following a separation from the booster.
- The launch was a test of a redesigned propulsion system and featured a reused Raptor engine.
- SpaceX suggests the explosion might have been caused by a fire in the ship’s rear section.
- Initial data indicates that debris fell within a designated hazard area, minimizing the risk.
- The event led to flight delays of up to 45 minutes from Miami and Fort Lauderdale airports.

sources.title: SpaceX’s fiery Starship explosion put on a fantastic show but delayed and diverted flights

title: Castlevania: Nocturne’s second season is another soft-spoken knockout
summary:
- Season 2 continues the story from Season 1, focusing on Richter Belmont's fight against Erzsebet Báthory during the French Revolution.
- The narrative emphasizes personal struggles and relationships amidst the backdrop of war and political unrest.
- Key characters like Erzsebet and Drolta face moral conflicts, highlighting the theme of personal transformation in the face of violence.
- The visual quality of the season is praised, particularly during action scenes, adding to the overall storytelling.
- Despite strong character development, some characters, like Annette, are noted to have less screen time compared to others.
- Season 2 is now available for streaming on Netflix, continuing its reputation as a standout video game adaptation.

sources.title: Castlevania: Nocturne’s second season is another soft-spoken knockout

title: Automakers sue to block Biden’s ‘flawed’ automatic emergency braking rule
summary:
- The Alliance of Automotive Innovation filed a lawsuit against a new rule mandating automatic emergency braking (AEB) by 2029.
- Major automakers including Ford, GM, and Toyota are represented in the suit, aiming to repeal the regulation they describe as “flawed.”
- The rule requires vehicles to automatically stop to avoid collisions at speeds up to 62mph and detect pedestrians at various speeds.
- NHTSA stated the rule is practicable and necessary for increasing safety standards in new vehicles.
- The auto alliance claims current technology cannot meet the requirements and prefers a previous voluntary agreement on AEB implementation.
- Consumer advocates support the rule, arguing it is crucial for roadway safety and should be achievable by the 2029 deadline.

sources.title: Automakers sue to block Biden’s ‘flawed’ automatic emergency braking rule

title: Nintendo omits original Donkey Kong Country Returns team from the remaster’s credits
summary:
- The launch of Donkey Kong Country Returns HD did not credit the original Retro Studios team members.
- Nintendo has addressed the omission, stating they value all contributions in game development.
- Crediting issues have been a recurrent problem in the industry, with previous controversies involving Metroid Prime and external translators.

sources.title: Nintendo omits original Donkey Kong Country Returns team from the remaster’s credits

title: AT&T pulls its 5G internet service in NY over new affordable internet law
summary:
- AT&T has announced it will discontinue its [5G Internet Air service](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/17/24346159/att-new-york-affordable-broadband-act-5g) in New York due to the state’s [Affordable Broadband Act](https://www.nysenate.gov/legislation/bills/2021/A6259) becoming effective.
- Existing users will have 45 days to transition to another provider without charges.
- The Affordable Broadband Act requires large providers to offer two affordable plans for low-income households, citing download speeds of 25Mbps for $15 and up to 200Mbps for $20.
- AT&T's Internet Air provided speeds of 40 to 140Mbps for $55 per month but chose to exit the market instead of adjusting to regulatory compliance.
- The law had been delayed due to pushback but was upheld after the US Supreme Court declined to intervene in December.
- AT&T argues that the law creates unsustainable rate regulations preventing future investment in broadband infrastructure.

sources.title: AT&T pulls its 5G internet service in NY over new affordable internet law

title: Instagram profile grids are going to feature rectangles instead of squares
summary:
- Instagram is changing profile grids from squares to rectangles as part of a rollout happening over the weekend.
- CEO Adam Mosseri explained the change is due to the increasing number of vertical photos and videos being uploaded.
- Mosseri acknowledged the transitional pain but believes users will appreciate seeing their content as intended.
- The change follows a limited test that occurred back in August 2024.
- Instagram is also introducing a feature to view videos liked by friends in the Reels feed.

sources.title: Instagram profile grids are going to feature rectangles instead of squares

title: CBS considers caving on Trump censorship lawsuit to save Paramount merger
summary:
- Donald Trump has filed a $10 billion lawsuit against CBS over the editing of a 60 Minutes interview with Kamala Harris.
- CBS' parent company, Paramount Global, is considering settling the lawsuit as it faces a government review of its merger with Skydance.
- Incoming FCC chairman Brendan Carr has warned that presidential dissatisfaction with CBS News could complicate the merger review process.
- The lawsuit claims CBS used deceptive practices in reporting on Harris’ response to a question about the war in Gaza.
- Paramount may follow other media companies like Disney in settling legal issues ahead of political changes.

sources.title: CBS considers caving on Trump censorship lawsuit to save Paramount merger

title: EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy and ceases operations
summary:
- Canoo has filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy and will cease operations immediately.
- The company owes between $10 million and $50 million to fewer than 49 creditors and claims to have less than $50,000 in assets.
- Canoo struggled to secure funding, including from the U.S. Department of Energy, and had previously furloughed employees and idled its factory in Oklahoma.

sources.title: EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy and ceases operations

title: The tech bros have front-row seats at Trump’s inauguration, but what they want goes way beyond that
summary:
- In his farewell speech, Joe Biden described the US as an oligarchy, highlighting concerns about wealth concentration.
- At least 13 billionaires are set to hold government positions under Trump, with an expected cabinet worth $7 billion.
- Silicon Valley figures, including Elon Musk and David Sacks, are poised for significant influence in the Trump administration.
- The article points to a growing convergence of corporate and political power, especially concerning tech and investment sectors.
- There is speculation about the future political strategy of tech moguls, who may seek to reduce regulations and enjoy greater profit margins.

sources.title: The tech bros have front-row seats at Trump’s inauguration, but what they want goes way beyond that

title: When kids set their parents’ screen time rules: ‘I hit my limit before I even get out of bed’
summary:
- Discussion on the disparity in screen time regulation between children and parents.
- Parents often overlook their own screen time habits, impacting familial interaction and child development.
- The author experimented with her teenage son's screen time limits, revealing challenges and insights about technology use in family dynamics.

sources.title: When kids set their parents’ screen time rules: ‘I hit my limit before I even get out of bed’

title: The mad dash to protect environmental data from Donald Trump
summary:
- Advocates warn that important environmental and public health datasets may be at risk with Donald Trump back in office.
- Significant cuts to federal agencies, including the EPA, could hinder data collection and access.
- The Environmental Justice Screening and Mapping Tool (EJScreen) is at risk due to proposed budget cuts and staffing reductions.
- A grassroots effort, the Environmental Data and Governance Initiative (EDGI), successfully archived significant data during Trump's first term.
- Current preparations are more robust to prevent data loss compared to 2016, utilizing new web tools and collaborative suggestions.

sources.title: The mad dash to protect environmental data from Donald Trump

title: Antonblast is an out-of-control platformer with its heart in the ’90s
summary: - Antonblast is a fast-paced platformer reminiscent of '90s games, launched in 2024. - Developed by Summitsphere, it combines elements from games like Sonic, Wario, and Crash Bandicoot. - Players control Anton or Annie to retrieve stolen spirits across 12 unique levels featuring various themes and mechanics, - The gameplay encourages building momentum and is designed to create a flow state despite its chaotic nature. - The game includes tough platforming challenges and epic boss fights that can be frustrating but are balanced by quick reloads. - Antonblast is available on Nintendo Switch and Steam.

sources.title: Antonblast is an out-of-control platformer with its heart in the ’90s

title: Instagram Reels Introduces New Features Amid TikTok Ban in the U.S.
summary: Instagram has rolled out updates to its Reels feature, introducing a new tab that displays videos liked by friends, reminiscent of the former activity feed removed in 2019. These updates aim to enhance social interaction among users as TikTok faces a ban in the U.S. beginning January 19. New features include a banner showing friends' likes and comments and a 'reply bar' for direct interactions with friends. Meta is targeting TikTok users and creators who may seek alternative monetization options after the ban, but there are concerns over privacy and users' willingness to publicly share their likes.

sources.title: Instagram will show your friends what Reels you’ve liked
Instagram Reels adds new features as TikTok is banned in the U.S.
Instagram Reels rolls out new features for U.S. users as TikTok gets banned

title: Cash App fined $255 million in back-to-back settlements
summary:
- Cash App is fined $255 million due to consumer protection violations.
- Block, the parent company, will pay $80 million for not complying with regulations against illicit activities.
- Additionally, Block will pay $120 million to customers and $55 million to the CFPB for weak security measures and fraud incidents.

sources.title: Cash App fined $255 million in back-to-back settlements

title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban law
summary:
- The Supreme Court ruled that a law could oust TikTok from the US unless ByteDance sells it, asserting its constitutionality.
- TikTok remains on track to be banned on January 19 unless President Biden intervenes or ByteDance sells the company.
- The court emphasized national security concerns over TikTok's data practices and foreign control.
- The ruling deemed the law as content neutral, supporting government interests without unduly burdening free expression.
- Justices expressed concerns about the speed of the proceedings and the law's content neutrality. 
- Potential buyers for TikTok are emerging, but the outcome for a sale remains uncertain amid geopolitical factors.

sources.title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban law

title: The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro, one of our favorite video doorbells, is cheaper than ever
summary:
- The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro is on sale for $149.99, a discount of $80, available until February 1st at 12:59AM ET.
- Features include 1536p video, motion detection with three sensors, color night vision, dual-band Wi-Fi, and smart responses.
- Subscription required for advanced features like smart alerts and recorded footage starting at $4.99/month or $49.99/year.
- It shares almost all features with the wired Pro 2 model, including radar motion detection to minimize nuisance notifications.
- Other deals mentioned include the Vornado MVH Whole Room Heater for $49.99 and the Apple Watch Series 9 for $279.

sources.title: The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro, one of our favorite video doorbells, is cheaper than ever

title: Instagram will show your friends what Reels you’ve liked
summary:
- Instagram introduces a new tab in the Reels feed displaying videos liked by friends.
- This feature is reminiscent of the old activity feed removed in 2019.
- Instagram aims to enhance social interaction over content shared among friends.
- Users can see which friends liked a post and left notes on Reels.
- Concerns raised about privacy and users' willingness to share their likes publicly.
- Competitive context with TikTok, as Reels attempts to draw users in during potential TikTok ban.

sources.title: Instagram will show your friends what Reels you’ve liked

title: Some of the Switch’s 2 first accessories are all about Mario Kart
summary:
- Nacon has revealed a folding desktop steering wheel accessory for the Switch 2’s redesigned Joy-Cons.
- The accessory will be priced at around $30.
- Other accessories announced include carrying cases, screen protectors, silicone wraps, and chargers designed for the Switch 2's ergonomic use in racing games.
- The next entry in the Mario Kart series was teased during the Switch 2 reveal, with more details expected in April 2025.
- Accessories are available on Nacon’s UK site but not for preorder or with shipping dates yet.

sources.title: Some of the Switch’s 2 first accessories are all about Mario Kart

title: Lawmakers press Meta, Apple, Google, and others on massive Trump donations
summary:
- Sens. Elizabeth Warren and Michael Bennet are questioning major tech firms about their $1 million donations to President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration fund.
- Companies including Google, Microsoft, Apple, Meta, Amazon, and OpenAI made these donations to potentially avoid regulatory scrutiny.
- The donations are notably higher than those made to President Joe Biden's 2021 inauguration.
- Lawmakers emphasize concerns about corporate influence over the Trump administration and have requested responses from the companies by January 30th.

sources.title: Lawmakers press Meta, Apple, Google, and others on massive Trump donations

title: A giant battery power plant is on fire in California
summary:
- A fire broke out at the Moss Landing Energy Storage Facility, the largest battery power plant in the world.
- Evacuation orders were issued for nearby residents, and parts of Highway 1 were closed.
- County health officials advised residents to shelter indoors and close windows and doors.
- Monterey County Supervisor described the situation as a disaster.
- Vistra will investigate the fire’s cause once it is under control.
- The facility expanded in 2023, adding over 110,000 battery modules for renewable energy storage.
- This incident follows previous battery fires in the area, including one at a PG&E facility in 2022.

sources.title: A giant battery power plant is on fire in California

title: Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd to reclaim CEO position in March
summary:
- Bumble announces Whitney Wolfe Herd will return as CEO in March 2025 after stepping down in 2023.
- Wolfe Herd succeeds Lidiane Jones, who is leaving for personal reasons and will assist in the transition.
- The company is facing sluggish growth, with Q3 2024 revenue declining to $274 million despite an increase in paying users to 4.3 million.
- Bumble expects forthcoming Q4 report to exceed previous revenue forecasts of $256 million to $262 million and adjusted EBITDA of $70 million to $73 million.

sources.title: Bumble founder Whitney Wolfe Herd to reclaim CEO position in March

title: Prime members can save $50 on the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft in its first sale
summary:
- The Kindle Colorsoft Signature Edition has dropped to $229.99, a $50 discount, for Prime members.
- It is Amazon’s first e-reader with a color display, featuring 32GB storage, waterproofing, and wireless charging support.
- The 7-inch display offers superior color reproduction but has a maximum resolution of 300ppi that reduces when using color.
- The battery life is advertised at eight weeks, shorter than the Paperwhite’s twelve weeks.
- Some early units suffered from a yellow discoloration issue, which Amazon claims to have fixed with hardware and software updates.

sources.title: Prime members can save $50 on the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft in its first sale

title: It’s perfectly fine to ignore your smartwatch this January
summary:
• January is the peak time for fitness tech companies to market New Year's resolutions.
• Introduction of "Quitter’s day", the second Friday in January when many abandon their resolutions, prompting Apple to release a motivational ad.
• The author experienced personal challenges at CES, highlighting the pressures of fitness tracking and reminders.
• Many quit their resolutions due to unrealistic expectations, not because of the technology itself.
• The author suggests turning off wearable notifications and trusting oneself in fitness journeys.

sources.title: It’s perfectly fine to ignore your smartwatch this January

title: Microsoft triples down on AI
summary:
- Microsoft announced the formation of a new AI engineering group called CoreAI, led by Jay Parikh, to enhance its AI platform and tools.
- The company introduced pay-as-you-go agents for its relaunched Copilot Chat and bundled AI features into Microsoft 365, raising subscription prices by $3 per month.
- Microsoft aims to automate services traditionally performed by humans, shifting from software-as-a-service to service-as-software, while addressing concerns from employees about the emphasis on AI.

sources.title: Microsoft triples down on AI

title: Malware stole internal PowerSchool passwords from engineer’s hacked computer
summary:
- A cyberattack at PowerSchool, discovered on December 28, threatens data of millions of students and teachers.
- Credentials were stolen from a PowerSchool engineer's computer by LummaC2 infostealing malware before the cyberattack.
- The engineer's device was hacked in January 2024, with logs indicating stolen passwords for various internal systems.
- PowerSchool stated the compromised account used for a breach lacked multi-factor authentication, a security feature now implemented.
- The breach exposed sensitive personal information including Social Security numbers and medical data of students.
- Affected school districts are assessing the extent of personal data theft, relying on shared efforts to search log files for evidence.

sources.title: Malware stole internal PowerSchool passwords from engineer’s hacked computer

title: Treasury sanctions Salt Typhoon hacking group behind breaches of major US telecom firms
summary:
- The U.S. government imposed sanctions on a China-based cybersecurity firm, Sichuan Juxinhe Network Technology, linked to the Salt Typhoon hacking group.
- Salt Typhoon is responsible for the largest telecom hack in U.S. history, affecting major companies like AT&T and Verizon.
- The group gained access to sensitive communications of U.S. officials and law enforcement data.
- OFAC also sanctioned Yin Kecheng, linked to a recent hack of the U.S. Treasury, which involved remote access to employee workstations using a stolen private key.

sources.title: Treasury sanctions Salt Typhoon hacking group behind breaches of major US telecom firms

title: Here’s how to play the Switch 2 early
summary:
- Nintendo is offering previews of the Switch 2 at live events across North America, Europe, and Asia.
- Demo cities include New York, Los Angeles, Dallas, and Toronto; registration details can be found on Nintendo’s website.
- Attendees must have a Nintendo account, and registration opens on January 17th, closing on January 26th.
- Tickets are free but awarded by lottery; only one time slot can be registered for per participant.

sources.title: Here’s how to play the Switch 2 early

title: Google begins requiring JavaScript for Google Search
summary:
- Google mandates users to enable JavaScript to use Google Search to enhance security and performance.
- The requirement aims to protect against bots and spam, improving search result quality.
- Approximately 95% of websites use JavaScript, but the change could hinder accessibility for some users.
- Users disabling JavaScript represent less than 0.1% of searches, translating to millions of users without JS.
- The new policy could disrupt third-party tools that analyze Google Search trends and rankings.

sources.title: Google begins requiring JavaScript for Google Search

title: TikTok Creators Prepare for Potential Ban Amid Trump's Comments
summary: With the Supreme Court upholding the law banning TikTok in the U.S. effective January 19, Donald Trump discussed the situation with Xi Jinping and hinted at a decision regarding TikTok in the near future. Creators are now contemplating migration to other platforms such as Instagram, YouTube, and Bluesky, as they share their other social account links and prepare for a possible shutdown of TikTok, which has been essential for their engagement and visibility.

sources.title: Trump Comments on TikTok Ban
6 TikTok creators on where they’ll go if the app is banned

title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 is here — sort of
summary:
- The Switch 2 exists and is confirmed to be bigger than its predecessor.
- Discussion on the features and trailers released regarding the Switch 2 during an episode of The Vergecast.
- The episode also covers recent news topics including a potential TikTok ban and the impact of various tech-related legal cases.

sources.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 is here — sort of

title: Maybe giant gaming handhelds are where it’s at
summary:
- The article discusses the trend of oversized gaming handhelds, specifically the Asus ROG Flow Z13 combined with a GameSir G8 Plus controller.
- The ROG Flow Z13 has a powerful AMD Strix Halo processor and provides high performance for gaming.
- Concerns are raised about the weight and handling of such large devices, which can lead to discomfort during use.
- The article explores the idea that bigger screens might be preferred in future handheld designs despite potential portability issues.
- Comparisons are made with other devices like the Nintendo Switch 2 and Acer Nitro Blaze 11, suggesting a shift in the gaming handheld market.

sources.title: Maybe giant gaming handhelds are where it’s at

title: Winter running gear: our top training essentials to help you conquer the cold
summary:
- Winter running can be enjoyable and beneficial for mental health.
- Essential gear includes protective headgear, chest lights, and more.
- Key items recommended are balances between warmth, visibility, and breathability.
- Outdoor running accessories are important for safety in low-light conditions.
- Recommendations include various brands and price points for each item's utility.
- Items such as the Arc’teryx balaclava, Proviz chest light, and Shokz headphones are highlighted.
- Emphasis on layering and moisture-wicking materials for comfort during winter workouts.

summary:
- The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro is on sale for $149.99, a discount of $80, available until February 1st at 12:59AM ET.
- Features include 1536p video, motion detection with three sensors, color night vision, dual-band Wi-Fi, and smart responses.
- Subscription required for advanced features like smart alerts and recorded footage starting at $4.99/month or $49.99/year.
- It shares almost all features with the wired Pro 2 model, including radar motion detection to minimize nuisance notifications.
- Other deals mentioned include the Vornado MVH Whole Room Heater for $49.99 and the Apple Watch Series 9 for $279.

sources.title: The Ring Battery Doorbell Pro, one of our favorite video doorbells, is cheaper than ever

title: Some of the Switch’s 2 first accessories are all about Mario Kart
summary:
- Nacon has revealed a folding desktop steering wheel accessory for the Switch 2’s redesigned Joy-Cons.
- The accessory will be priced at around $30.
- Other accessories announced include carrying cases, screen protectors, silicone wraps, and chargers designed for the Switch 2's ergonomic use in racing games.
- The next entry in the Mario Kart series was teased during the Switch 2 reveal, with more details expected in April 2025.
- Accessories are available on Nacon’s UK site but not for preorder or with shipping dates yet.

title: Lawmakers press Meta, Apple, Google, and others on massive Trump donations
summary:
- Sens. Elizabeth Warren and Michael Bennet are questioning major tech firms about their $1 million donations to President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration fund.
- Companies including Google, Microsoft, Apple, Meta, Amazon, and OpenAI made these donations to potentially avoid regulatory scrutiny.
- The donations are notably higher than those made to President Joe Biden's 2021 inauguration.
- Lawmakers emphasize concerns about corporate influence over the Trump administration and have requested responses from the companies by January 30th.

sources.title: Lawmakers press Meta, Apple, Google, and others on massive Trump donations

title: A giant battery power plant is on fire in California
summary:
- A fire broke out at the Moss Landing Energy Storage Facility, the largest battery power plant in the world.
- Evacuation orders were issued for nearby residents, and parts of Highway 1 were closed.
- County health officials advised residents to shelter indoors and close windows and doors.
- Monterey County Supervisor described the situation as a disaster.
- Vistra will investigate the fire’s cause once it is under control.
- The facility expanded in 2023, adding over 110,000 battery modules for renewable energy storage.
- This incident follows previous battery fires in the area, including one at a PG&E facility in 2022.

sources.title: A giant battery power plant is on fire in California

title: Prime members can save $50 on the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft in its first sale
summary:
- The Kindle Colorsoft Signature Edition has dropped to $229.99, a $50 discount, for Prime members.
- It is Amazon’s first e-reader with a color display, featuring 32GB storage, waterproofing, and wireless charging support.
- The 7-inch display offers superior color reproduction but has a maximum resolution of 300ppi that reduces when using color.
- The battery life is advertised at eight weeks, shorter than the Paperwhite’s twelve weeks.
- Some early units suffered from a yellow discoloration issue, which Amazon claims to have fixed with hardware and software updates.

sources.title: Prime members can save $50 on the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft in its first sale

title: It’s perfectly fine to ignore your smartwatch this January
summary:
• January is the peak time for fitness tech companies to market New Year's resolutions.
• Introduction of "Quitter’s day", the second Friday in January when many abandon their resolutions, prompting Apple to release a motivational ad.
• The author experienced personal challenges at CES, highlighting the pressures of fitness tracking and reminders.
• Many quit their resolutions due to unrealistic expectations, not because of the technology itself.
• The author suggests turning off wearable notifications and trusting oneself in fitness journeys.

sources.title: It’s perfectly fine to ignore your smartwatch this January

title: Microsoft triples down on AI
summary:
- Microsoft announced the formation of a new AI engineering group called CoreAI, led by Jay Parikh, to enhance its AI platform and tools.
- The company introduced pay-as-you-go agents for its relaunched Copilot Chat and bundled AI features into Microsoft 365, raising subscription prices by $3 per month.
- Microsoft aims to automate services traditionally performed by humans, shifting from software-as-a-service to service-as-software, while addressing concerns from employees about the emphasis on AI.

sources.title: Microsoft triples down on AI

title: Treasury sanctions Salt Typhoon hacking group behind breaches of major US telecom firms
summary:
- The U.S. government imposed sanctions on a China-based cybersecurity firm, Sichuan Juxinhe Network Technology, linked to the Salt Typhoon hacking group.
- Salt Typhoon is responsible for the largest telecom hack in U.S. history, affecting major companies like AT&T and Verizon.
- The group gained access to sensitive communications of U.S. officials and law enforcement data.
- OFAC also sanctioned Yin Kecheng, linked to a recent hack of the U.S. Treasury, which involved remote access to employee workstations using a stolen private key.

sources.title: Treasury sanctions Salt Typhoon hacking group behind breaches of major US telecom firms

title: Maybe giant gaming handhelds are where it’s at
summary:
- The article discusses the trend of oversized gaming handhelds, specifically the Asus ROG Flow Z13 combined with a GameSir G8 Plus controller.
- The ROG Flow Z13 has a powerful AMD Strix Halo processor and provides high performance for gaming.
- Concerns are raised about the weight and handling of such large devices, which can lead to discomfort during use.
- The article explores the idea that bigger screens might be preferred in future handheld designs despite potential portability issues.
- Comparisons are made with other devices like the Nintendo Switch 2 and Acer Nitro Blaze 11, suggesting a shift in the gaming handheld market.

sources.title: Maybe giant gaming handhelds are where it’s at

title: Cash App fined $255 million in back-to-back settlements
summary:
- Cash App is fined $255 million due to consumer protection violations.
- Block, the parent company, will pay $80 million for not complying with regulations against illicit activities.
- Additionally, Block will pay $120 million to customers and $55 million to the CFPB for weak security measures and fraud incidents.

sources.title: Cash App fined $255 million in back-to-back settlements

title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban law
summary:
- The Supreme Court ruled that a law could oust TikTok from the US unless ByteDance sells it, asserting its constitutionality.
- TikTok remains on track to be banned on January 19 unless President Biden intervenes or ByteDance sells the company.
- The court emphasized national security concerns over TikTok's data practices and foreign control.
- The ruling deemed the law as content neutral, supporting government interests without unduly burdening free expression.
- Justices expressed concerns about the speed of the proceedings and the law's content neutrality. 
- Potential buyers for TikTok are emerging, but the outcome for a sale remains uncertain amid geopolitical factors.

sources.title: Supreme Court upholds TikTok ban law

title: Instagram will show your friends what Reels you’ve liked
summary:
- Instagram introduces a new tab in the Reels feed displaying videos liked by friends.
- This feature is reminiscent of the old activity feed removed in 2019.
- Instagram aims to enhance social interaction over content shared among friends.
- Users can see which friends liked a post and left notes on Reels.
- Concerns raised about privacy and users' willingness to share their likes publicly.
- Competitive context with TikTok, as Reels attempts to draw users in during potential TikTok ban.

title: Malware stole internal PowerSchool passwords from engineer’s hacked computer
summary:
- A cyberattack at PowerSchool, discovered on December 28, threatens data of millions of students and teachers.
- Credentials were stolen from a PowerSchool engineer's computer by LummaC2 infostealing malware before the cyberattack.
- The engineer's device was hacked in January 2024, with logs indicating stolen passwords for various internal systems.
- PowerSchool stated the compromised account used for a breach lacked multi-factor authentication, a security feature now implemented.
- The breach exposed sensitive personal information including Social Security numbers and medical data of students.
- Affected school districts are assessing the extent of personal data theft, relying on shared efforts to search log files for evidence.

sources.title: Malware stole internal PowerSchool passwords from engineer’s hacked computer

title: Here’s how to play the Switch 2 early
summary:
- Nintendo is offering previews of the Switch 2 at live events across North America, Europe, and Asia.
- Demo cities include New York, Los Angeles, Dallas, and Toronto; registration details can be found on Nintendo’s website.
- Attendees must have a Nintendo account, and registration opens on January 17th, closing on January 26th.
- Tickets are free but awarded by lottery; only one time slot can be registered for per participant.

sources.title: Here’s how to play the Switch 2 early

title: Google begins requiring JavaScript for Google Search
summary:
- Google mandates users to enable JavaScript to use Google Search to enhance security and performance.
- The requirement aims to protect against bots and spam, improving search result quality.
- Approximately 95% of websites use JavaScript, but the change could hinder accessibility for some users.
- Users disabling JavaScript represent less than 0.1% of searches, translating to millions of users without JS.
- The new policy could disrupt third-party tools that analyze Google Search trends and rankings.

sources.title: Google begins requiring JavaScript for Google Search

title: 6 TikTok creators on where they’ll go if the app is banned
summary:
- Creators discuss potential migration if TikTok is banned following legislative actions by President Biden.
- Many influencers are already sharing their other social account links and saying goodbye to TikTok.
- Creators like Noelle Johansen and Kay Poyer outline their plans to shift focus to platforms like Instagram, YouTube, and Bluesky.
- TikTok has become a crucial space for engagement, especially for smaller creators who rely on its unpredictability for visibility.
- Some creators express concerns about the community and connection challenges that come with moving to new platforms.

sources.title: 6 TikTok creators on where they’ll go if the app is banned

summary:

- The episode also covers recent news topics including a potential TikTok ban and the impact of various tech-related legal cases.
